bug.short_desc: don't access network/load latest repo metadata when doing "list installed"
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: when doing "dnf list installed 'libinput*'", dnf tries to load the latest repo metadata from network. This step should be skipped for "list installed" which should only rely on the rpm db for installed components.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): $ dnf --version 1.1.10 Installiert: dnf-0:1.1.10-1.fc24.noarch am 2016-09-01 19:19 Erstellt : Fedora Project am 2016-08-18 14:39
Installiert: rpm-0:4.13.0-0.rc1.27.fc24.x86_64 am 2016-06-22 06:05 Erstellt : Fedora Project am 2016-04-25 13:45
How reproducible:
Steps to Reproduce: 1. 2. 3.
Actual results:
Expected results:
Additional info:

it's not possible to fix it easily, so low priority.
Meanwhile you can use "-C" parameter.
I created a pull-request that should solve the problem (https://github.com/rpm-software-management/dnf/pull/817)
dnf-plugins-core-2.1.1-1.fc26 libdnf-0.9.1-1.fc26 dnf-2.5.1-1.fc26 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 26. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-c87c47dccb
